title: Matchmaking is tilting in itself, Can this change?

replies.body: I mean match making has always been shit. The reality is, people think its worse now, but back in the day of season 2 and 3. That was a full out war zone. Didn't get your role? Most people would then troll you. Plus you cannot magically just change shit and expect it to be good. It will never be good, why? Human beings are unpredictable. Sometimes you get a game, people suck. Other times you get the great team. Take it in strides people, some shit you just have to cut your loses and move on.

I actually liked the old matchmaking system, i don't think it was that bad. i would say the trolls were slightly higher back than, but people troll in the auto fill supp position all the time now as well. At least back in the day if you choose fill  i definitely felt like at least i was able to play most of the positions, now if you just fill you might as well be a " support main", which i still chose fill because I don't mind supporting most of the time, but when its around 90% of the time a supp game, its not really filling anymore.

Matchmaking is wonky, but complaining about getting the same toxic people two games in a row... you do realize you can wait five minutes before queueing again, right? If there's someone you want to avoid, go take a piss or make a sandwich before you queue so the odds of falling in with them decrease. It doesn't take long to more or less guarantee you'll find different players unless you're super-high rank.
Real talk. Also if you have a tilting loss you SHOULD take a break anyways

True.
Tilting is so easy.
Doesn't matter how thick-skinned you are, eventually you're going to be annoyed by something. And if you keep hitting that spot over and over, it's going to be past the point of no return. All you need is bad attitude in one game to ruin your experience entirely.

This game has always been rigged in terms of matchmaking. I was on a win streak. Suddenly started to get matched with literally newbies. It felt like they didn't knew the basic knowledge. Like don't go into enemy jungle alone in mid/late game. Or ward maybe. Or don't fight a 5/0 guy you fed and feed him even further. Or I got people who don't even know what champions do etc. 

But then when I lost enough to get my MMR destroyed I begin to get decent teammates who even if the lose lane they can actually do something regardless and try to fix their mistakes instead of "XD it's FF" after feeding to oblivion. What is most funny enemies are same as they were when I was on a winning streak. 

What is very interesting is that after win streak you start to get matched with people on hard lose streaks or playing most games with champs they have low win rate on. While when you are on win streak your teammates are on winning streak as well.all positive etc.

Your MMR gets to the next tier or above in my case and then you get paired with people that are unranked or have 30% WR's literally...despite your own MMR and WR being way higher and eventually lose enough to tank your MMR and you continually get shit on and drop rank getting paired with people who intentionally throw, rage quit, or are completely unskilled while not even being ranked.  Match Making is Bull$hit!! Play 200 matches maintaining a 60% WR to get thrown in with 3 unranked players in your damn promos... or 30-40% WR's!!!  Literally, use op.gg for live matches and you will see exactly what is being discussed here.  It's really frustrating and a turn off...even from a game that I like and have spent money on.

It would also help not pairing people who know basic concepts of counterbuilding with people who don't even know what statistics mean. Yep, I just played a game with 4 AP champ who didn't buy Zhonya vs Zed. 
Riot, this SUCKS.
This is NOT FUN. Who the fuck is supposed to keep their cool in situations like that?

#Sounds like you literally have to just not queue up the instant you lose a game.

That would fix your problem - just wait 5 minutes. There's a big pool of players of the same ELO to be matched with at most times so the matchmaker doesn't "recycle" players. But if you queue up back to back after you got tilted by a teammate, there's a good chance they did that too and you find yourselves pressing the same "play again" button at the same time, resulting in increased chances to be in the same game (not necessarily the same team).

I get that way too after someone tilts me and the urge to just play again instantly and not end my day in a loss is strong. But taking a 5 minute break in between losses helps me unwind a bit and not carry the same shitty mentality in my other games and blame my new teammates for the mistakes of my past teammates. Yea, they could be the same mistakes but me being the reason why i'm tiling again isn't helping me or my team play the game any better.

I think you've mixed a couple of different issues here.
Matchmaking is awful, and not intended to get balanced (and then enjoyable) games; it's just about the 50% win ratio.

So, it doesn't matter who you reported before, nor if your teammates know how to ward (besides that means they are probably not really good, so if you've been matched with them it's probably because your time to lose has come :P).
I've completely stopped playing ranked till this shit gets fixed. Been about a year and a half now.

Thats only really an issue in the higher tiers or a server that has not that many players like OCE. If you Q up again right after the game you gonna be thrown in with the same people that do it aswell.
If youre in a game with someone who was frustrating or tilted, wait 5-10 before queuing up again. Theyll queue and get into a game and youll be able to do so in peace.

I wish i had the option to mute teammates in champ select, i really do, often they try to force picks that you are not comfortable with playing, want your role or, criticize your picks so you are a little tilted going into the game. You used to be able to block someone and couldn't see their chat in champ select but for some reason they took it away as if people are less toxic outside of game or something.
